dtliExcerpt: If you saw “Art” back in its heyday, you likely forgot the finer points of the plot. It is forgettable. But there is no credible arguing with this level of audience-pleasing success. This very fun revival at least makes the case that forgettability can be an asset and “Art’ enjoyed over and over again.

keyPhrases.quote: This very fun revival at least makes the case that forgettability can be an asset.
There is no credible arguing with this level of audience-pleasing success.

llmScore.reasoning: Despite calling the plot 'forgettable,' the critic frames this as an asset and emphasizes the production's 'audience-pleasing success' and 'very fun' qualities, indicating a clear positive recommendation.
